org.codemonkey.util
Interface Executable<Controller,ExecutionException extends RuntimeException>

Type Parameters:
Controller - The context object provided to the implementing class to delegate to.
ExecutionException - RuntimeException type that can optionally be thrown by the implementing class.
All Known Subinterfaces:
ServerMessageToClient<Controller>
public interface Executable<Controller,ExecutionException extends RuntimeException>

Marks an object executable. Used on conjunction with ServerMessageToClient to handle messages in two phases:

  1. decode raw message
  2. execute decoded message

Since:
1.0
Author:
Benny Bottema
See Also:
ServerMessageToClient

Method Summary
 void execute(Controller controller)
          Executes the object like a 'command' object making it interact with the provided controller argument.
 

Method Detail

execute

void execute(Controller controller)
             throws ExecutionException extends RuntimeException
Executes the object like a 'command' object making it interact with the provided controller argument.

Parameters:
controller - A specific class against which the executable implementation is executed against, allowing the object to interact with a known model.
Throws:
ExecutionException - May be thrown by the implementing class for whatever purpose it deems necessary.
ExecutionException extends RuntimeException
